data.title: Best Colleges in Tennessee
data.meta_description: Looking for info on the best colleges in Tennessee? Our latest guide to TN Best Colleges will answer all your questions today!
data.text:
Best Colleges in Tennessee – Introduction

For those interested in attending a southern school, the best colleges in Tennessee are great universities to explore. TN best colleges each provide students with exciting opportunities to pursue a degree in a unique college setting. So, let’s learn more about why students choose to attend top colleges in Tennessee.

Tennessee is recognized as the birthplace of country, bluegrass, blues, southern gospel, and rock ‘n’ roll. You’ll also find amazing food, including pulled pork and hot chicken, desserts like moon pies or stack cake, ramps (wild leeks), and fried pickles. Students who attend TN best colleges can also explore Tennessee’s natural beauty by rock climbing, hiking, waterskiing, or visiting the Great Smoky Mountains.

Overall, Tennessee is a great college location, and top colleges in Tennessee offer students plenty of options. If you’re interested in going to school in Tennessee, you may be wondering about TN best colleges.

In our guide to the Best Colleges in Tennessee, we’ll discuss:

Our ranking of the 10 best colleges in Tennessee

Public and private colleges in Tennessee

Which Ivy League and HBCU schools are located in Tennessee

A map of top colleges in Tennessee

Community colleges in Tennessee

The best colleges in Tennessee for business, engineering, pre-med, and nursing

How to decide the best colleges in Tennessee for you, and more!

Before we dive into our complete list of the TN best colleges, let’s see which school tops the list.

What is the best university in Tennessee?

Based on national rankings, Vanderbilt is the best university in Tennessee. So, you won’t be surprised when you see Vanderbilt ranking highly across many college lists.

According to U.S. News, the Vanderbilt ranking is #13 in National Universities (making it one of the best colleges in the US). It’s also ranked #8 in Best Value Schools, which accounts for both academic quality and overall cost. Approximately 65% of students receive financial aid, making Vanderbilt an affordable choice for many students.

Here’s another fun fact about one of the best colleges in Tennessee: the Vanderbilt ranking is #1 for students’ overall satisfaction. There’s a lot to love about Vanderbilt, including its beautiful Nashville campus. And, with 475 interest organizations and over 35 club and varsity teams, there’s something for everyone on campus.

Alumni achievement at Vanderbilt

As one of the best colleges in Tennessee, it’s no surprise that Vanderbilt has many accomplished alumni. Barney S. Graham (Ph.D. ’91) helped develop the first experimental COVID-19 vaccines. James Patterson (MA ’70) is a world-renowned author and the creator of the Patterson Fellowships, which brings distinguished scholars to Vanderbilt’s campus. Dr. Mildred T. Stahlman (BA’43, MD’46, HO’48) developed the first modern neonatal intensive care unit in the U.S. Like other top colleges in Tennessee, Vanderbilt has many distinguished alumni.

Considering its accolades and prestige, it’s no surprise Vanderbilt tops our list of best colleges in Tennessee. While Vanderbilt may be renowned among TN best colleges, there are many more top colleges in Tennessee.

Top 10 best colleges in Tennessee

Now let’s take a look at some other top colleges in Tennessee. We’ll give an overview of each of our TN best colleges, including location, how they rank among the best colleges in the US, acceptance rates, and more.

Here are the top 10 colleges in Tennessee according to U.S. News:

What Ivy League school is in Tennessee?

There are no Ivy League universities in Tennessee. Still, you’ll find plenty of great colleges in Tennessee, from public universities to private colleges. You can count on getting an excellent education at any of the top colleges in Tennessee.

Known as a “southern Ivy,” Vanderbilt is universally recognized as one of the best universities in the nation. Students at Vanderbilt can expect to receive an education on par with the one they would receive from any Ivy League school.

Colleges in Tennessee Map

Now, just where are the TN best colleges? Let’s take a look at our colleges in Tennessee map. Our colleges in Tennessee map includes schools in Nashville, Knoxville, and other major cities in Tennessee. Many of our TN best colleges are located in Tennessee’s capital.

In Nashville, you’ll find:

Vanderbilt University

Belmont University

Lipscomb University

About 3 hours away from Nashville is the city of Knoxville. Located in eastern Tennessee, Knoxville is known for its food, music scene, natural beauty, and festivals. In Knoxville, you’ll find several of our TN best colleges, including the University of Tennessee, as well as Johnson University and Maryville College (not pictured on our map).

As you can see, TN best colleges are located throughout the state. Refer back to our colleges in Tennessee map to see which schools share the same college location.

How many colleges are in Tennessee?

There are a total of 105 public and private colleges in Tennessee. This includes:

23 public institutions

48 nonprofit private institutions

34 for-profit private institutions

Some top public colleges in Tennessee include the University of Memphis, Tennessee Tech, The University of Tennessee, and the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga and Martin. These are some of the best colleges in Tennessee for in-state students.

Public colleges in Tennessee

Many of the public TN best colleges are part of the University of Tennessee System. The UT system is Tennessee’s oldest and largest public institution of higher education. It was formed in 1968 and enrolls close to 54,000 graduate and undergraduate students. The UT System includes many great colleges in Tennessee, including:

University of Tennessee Knoxville

University of Tennessee Chattanooga

University of Tennessee Southern at Pulaski

University of Tennessee Martin

The Health Science Center at Memphis

The statewide Institute of Agriculture and Institute for Public Service

Top private colleges in Tennessee include Vanderbilt, Lipscomb University, Union University, and Lincoln Memorial. These are some of the best colleges in Tennessee for students who value smaller class sizes and a close-knit community.

Maybe, rather than looking at the best colleges in Tennessee, you’re only interested in colleges in a specific city. So, let’s look at TN best colleges in Nashville.

How many colleges are in Nashville?

According to the Nashville Chamber of Commerce, there are over 30 colleges and universities in the Nashville area. You can find art colleges, public colleges, and private colleges in Tennessee’s capital. Students interested in TN best colleges for art might want to check out Nossi College of Art & Design and the Watkins College of Art at Belmont University.

According to U.S. News, the best colleges in Nashville are:

Vanderbilt University

Belmont University

Lipscomb University

Middle Tennessee State University

Fisk University

Welch College

Cumberland University

Tennessee State University

Nashville, also known as Music City, is a dynamic place for students to attend college. While many are familiar with Nashville’s musical heritage, the city is also home to countless museums, performing arts venues, historic landmarks, art galleries, and more. Students who attend one of the TN best colleges in Nashville will find no shortage of attractions.

Community Colleges in Tennessee

Tennessee also offers community colleges for students who aren’t ready to pursue a four-year degree. Students can also transfer from community colleges in Tennessee to many TN best colleges.

Generally, community colleges in Tennessee will have a transfer center, which helps students navigate the transfer process. Now, let’s learn more about a few great community colleges in Tennessee.

Some community colleges in Tennessee, like Jackson State, are part of the Tennessee Board of Regents. This group includes 13 community colleges, each with a specific service area.

The other colleges in the Tennessee Board of Regents system are:

Chattanooga State

Cleveland State

Columbia State

Dyersburg State

Motlow State

Nashville State

Northeast State

Pellissippi State

Roane State

Southwest Tennessee

Volunteer State

Walters State

Community colleges in Tennessee are a great option for in-state students looking for affordable and flexible education.

While community colleges in Tennessee can be more cost-friendly than other four-year universities, they aren’t free. Next, let’s talk about what it costs to attend colleges in Tennessee and review options to help make colleges in Tennessee more affordable.

Is college free in Tennessee?

No, colleges in Tennessee are not free. At most major universities and colleges in Tennessee, students will pay similar amounts in tuition and fees that they would pay in other states. However, under the Tennessee Promise, students can attend community colleges in Tennessee free of charge.

Tennessee Promise

In addition to covering tuition and fees for students, Tennessee Promise also pairs participants with a mentor who will help them through the college admissions process. No matter which of the many colleges in Tennessee students choose, they must complete eight hours of community service each term and maintain a minimum 2.0 GPA to receive their scholarship.

HOPE Scholarship

The Tennessee HOPE Scholarship can also help students fund the cost of attending college in Tennessee. In order to be eligible for the HOPE scholarship, students must:

Be a resident of Tennessee

Graduate from an eligible TN high school

Enroll in one of Tennessee’s public or private colleges or universities within 16 months following high school graduation

Achieve a minimum of 21 ACT or 1060 SAT

Maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA

If students are selected for the HOPE scholarship, they’ll receive:

Up to $2,250/semester as a full-time freshman and sophomore; then up to $2,850/semester as a junior and senior (at 4-year institutions and 2-year institutions with on-campus housing)

Up to $1,600/semester as a freshman and sophomore (at 2-year institutions)

Awards are also available for summer enrollment. Students can expect to receive their scholarship until they earn their baccalaureate degree or five years have passed from their initial date of enrollment.

How many HBCU are in Tennessee?

There are 7 HBCU schools in Tennessee. HBCU are some of the best colleges in Tennessee for students looking for a supportive faculty and community. The HBCU in Tennessee each offer a unique experience. Many students choose to attend HBCU for their inclusivity, legacy, and values.

Now, let’s take a look at the top HBCU in Tennessee. We’ll include info on a variety of schools and key details about them, like the Fisk University ranking or the Tennessee State University acceptance rate.

HBCU in Tennessee

No list of TN best colleges would be complete without highlighting the HBCU in Tennessee. Here are the HBCU schools in Tennessee:

Now that we’ve looked at HBCU TN best colleges, let’s keep learning about the best colleges in Tennessee. First, we’ll take a look at the largest university in Tennessee. Then, we’ll look at top colleges in Tennessee by major.

What is the largest university in Tennessee?

The University of Tennessee – Knoxville is the largest university in Tennessee.

As a large university, UT Knoxville offers students a wide selection of majors and resources for career development. Students can choose from over 360 programs of study across nine colleges. For students who aren’t sure which major or career they want to pursue, the Division of Student Success has a Center for Career Development & Academic Exploration.

University of Tennessee Admissions accepts applications through the Common App. However, students will also need to create a Go Vols account. There, you’ll register for campus tours and apply for Honors & Scholars programs and cohort programs. For students who want to learn more about attending one of TN best colleges, University of Tennessee admissions offers the opportunity to chat virtually with students and faculty.

Best Colleges in Tennessee – By Major

If you already know what you want to study in college, you may be curious about the best colleges in Tennessee by major. Up next, we’ll look at the best colleges in Tennessee for engineering, business, pre-med, and nursing.

While a list of top colleges in Tennessee can be a great place to start your college search, they won’t necessarily reflect your particular needs. Looking at TN best colleges related to your chosen field can help you find the best colleges in Tennessee for you.

Best Colleges in Tennessee for Engineering

There is no definitive ranking for the best undergraduate engineering colleges in Tennessee. So, this data comes from the U.S. News graduate rankings. Here is our list of the best colleges in Tennessee for engineering:

Any of these schools would be great options for engineering colleges in Tennessee. Next, let’s look at the best colleges in Tennessee for business.

Best Colleges in Tennessee for Business

Once again, the most reliable rankings for the best colleges in Tennessee for business come from these schools’ graduate-level programs. However, these schools will all have strong faculties and course structures at the undergraduate level as well.

Here is our list of the best colleges in Tennessee for business:

Up next, we’ve got even more great colleges in Tennessee. Let’s take a look at TN best colleges for pre-med.

Best Colleges in Tennessee for Pre-med

Since pre-med is not technically a major, we’ve compiled schools with strong programs in pre-med-related fields (like biology or chemistry). Here is our list of the best colleges in Tennessee for pre-med:

Now that we’ve learned a bit about the best colleges in Tennessee for pre-med, let’s take a look at some colleges in Tennessee for nursing.

Colleges in Tennessee for Nursing

There is no definitive undergraduate ranking for the best colleges in Tennessee for nursing. However, U.S. News ranks the best master’s programs for students pursuing an advanced nursing degree.

Here is our list of the best colleges in Tennessee for nursing:

As you can see, there are many great colleges in Tennessee for nursing and other popular majors that you can find on our list of best colleges in Tennessee. So, how do you decide which TN best colleges to apply to?

Best college in Tennessee for you!

It may be tempting to apply to schools on our list of top colleges in Tennessee. However, they won’t all necessarily be a great fit for you. All of these colleges in Tennessee have programs and qualities that make them unique. So, finding the best colleges in Tennessee for you will require some research.

College size and setting

First off, you might want to consider college size. Generally, schools can be categorized as small, medium, or large universities. For example, there’s a big difference between a school with an undergraduate population of 7,111, like Vanderbilt, and 25,067, like the University of Tennessee – Knoxville. Smaller schools tend to have tighter-knit communities, whereas larger schools often have opportunities to be a part of a diverse student body.

You’ll also want to take into account the college setting. The top colleges in Tennessee are located in different types of cities that will impact your college experience. Think about whether you want a more urban or rural setting. Rural areas often have beautiful natural landscapes for hikers, runners, and outdoorsy people. A more urban college location, by contrast, can mean more exciting cultural experiences and opportunities for jobs and internships in various fields.

Educational differences

While you can expect to receive a strong education at all of the best colleges in the US, colleges in Tennessee will each have a unique approach. You may benefit from a more specialized, narrowed concentration in your chosen field. Or, you may want a liberal arts education with a more interdisciplinary curriculum. While the best colleges in Tennessee are all great schools, be sure to check out your specific major’s department and see if their offerings align with your interests.

You’ll also want to consider whether you’re open to both public and private colleges in Tennessee. Public colleges can be more affordable for in-state students, whereas private colleges often offer more need-based financial aid. All of the TN best colleges have financial aid websites where you can learn more about specific costs.

Best Colleges in Tennessee Takeaways

After reviewing this guide, we hope you see how many great colleges in Tennessee there are. We discussed private and public colleges in Tennessee and the benefits of each. Additionally, we highlighted the HBCU in Tennessee and three community colleges in Tennessee. Finally, we talked about college settings and showed you where you can find colleges in Tennessee, Nashville, Knoxville, and other cities.

Choosing between colleges in Tennessee can be challenging. If you need help deciding which colleges in Tennessee are right for you, CollegeAdvisor is here to help. Click here to schedule a meeting with our team.
